chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
T: Type
s0: SF_seq
s: SF_seq

Goal:
s = s0 -> SF_lx s = SF_lx s0

Premises:
SF_lx = fun s : SF_seq => SF_h s :: unzip1 (SF_t s) : SF_seq -> seq R
SF_lx_cons : forall (h : R * T) (s : SF_seq), SF_lx (SF_cons h s) = fst h :: SF_lx s
SF_lx_rcons : forall (s : SF_seq) (h : R * T), SF_lx (SF_rcons s h) = rcons (SF_lx s) (fst h)
SF_h = fun s : SF_seq => let (SF_h, _) := s in SF_h : SF_seq -> R
rcons_dec : forall P : seq ?T -> Type, P [::] -> (forall (s1 : seq ?T) (t : ?T), P (rcons s1 t)) -> forall s : seq ?T, P s where ?T : [T : Type s : SF_seq s0 : SF_seq |- Type]
rcons_ind : forall P : seq ?T -> Type, P [::] -> (forall (s1 : seq ?T) (t : ?T), P s1 -> P (rcons s1 t)) -> forall s : seq ?T, P s where ?T : [T : Type s : SF_seq s0 : SF_seq |- Type]
SF_lx_nil : forall x0 : R, SF_lx (SF_nil x0) = [:: x0]
SF_t = fun s : SF_seq => let (_, SF_t) := s in SF_t : SF_seq -> seq (R * T)
SF_ly = fun s : SF_seq => unzip2 (SF_t s) : SF_seq -> seq T
SF_seq_bij_lx : forall (lx : seq R) (ly : seq T) (Hs : size lx = S (size ly)), SF_lx (SF_make lx ly Hs) = lx
SF_cons = fun (h : R * T) (s : SF_seq) => {| SF_h := fst h; SF_t := (SF_h s, snd h) :: SF_t s |} : R * T -> SF_seq -> SF_seq
SF_rcons_ind : forall P : SF_seq -> Type, (forall x0 : R, P (SF_nil x0)) -> (forall (s : SF_seq) (t : R * T), P s -> P (SF_rcons s t)) -> forall s : SF_seq, P s
SF_rcons_dec : forall P : SF_seq -> Type, (forall x0 : R, P (SF_nil x0)) -> (forall (s : SF_seq) (t : R * T), P (SF_rcons s t)) -> forall s : SF_seq, P s
SF_cons_ind : forall P : SF_seq -> Type, (forall x0 : R, P (SF_nil x0)) -> (forall (h : R * T) (s : SF_seq), P s -> P (SF_cons h s)) -> forall s : SF_seq, P s
SF_cons_dec : forall P : SF_seq -> Type, (forall x0 : R, P (SF_nil x0)) -> (forall (h : R * T) (s : SF_seq), P (SF_cons h s)) -> forall s : SF_seq, P s
Rlist2seq_bij : forall s : seq R, Rlist2seq (seq2Rlist s) = s
SF_seq_bij : forall s : SF_seq, SF_make (SF_lx s) (SF_ly s) (SF_size_lx_ly s) = s
unzip1_zip : forall (S T : Type) (s : seq S) (t : seq T), ssrnat.leq (size s) (size t) -> unzip1 (zip s t) = s
nth0 : forall (T : Type) (x0 : T) (s : seq T), nth x0 s 0 = head x0 s
Rabs_R0 = match Rcase_abs 0 as s return ((if s then - 0 else 0) = 0) with | left r => (fun H : ~ 0 < 0 => False_ind (- 0 = 0) (H r)) (Rlt_irrefl 0) | right _ => eq_refl end : Rabs 0 = 0
SF_rcons = fun (s : SF_seq) (t : R * T) => {| SF_h := SF_h s; SF_t := rcons (SF_t s) t |} : SF_seq -> R * T -> SF_seq
SF_size_lx_ly : forall s : SF_seq, size (SF_lx s) = S (size (SF_ly s))
SF_make : forall (lx : seq R) (ly : seq T), size lx = S (size ly) -> SF_seq
SF_nil = fun x0 : R => {| SF_h := x0; SF_t := [::] |} : R -> SF_seq Argument scope is [R_scope]
zip_unzip : forall (S T : Type) (s : seq (S * T)), zip (unzip1 s) (unzip2 s) = s
Rlist2seq = fix Rlist2seq (s : Rlist) : seq R := match s with | nil => [::] | cons h t => h :: Rlist2seq t end : Rlist -> seq R
SF_ly_rcons : forall (s : SF_seq) (h : R * T), SF_ly (SF_rcons s h) = rcons (SF_ly s) (snd h)
SF_ly_cons : forall (h : R * T) (s : SF_seq), SF_ly (SF_cons h s) = snd h :: SF_ly s
size_rcons : forall (T : Type) (s : seq T) (x : T), size (rcons s x) = S (size s)
last_rcons : forall (T : Type) (x : T) (s : seq T) (z : T), last x (rcons s z) = z
infinite_sum = fun (s : nat -> R) (l : R) => forall eps : R, eps > 0 -> exists N : nat, forall n : nat, (n >= N)%nat -> R_dist (sum_f_R0 s n) l < eps : (nat -> R) -> R -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope R_scope]
seq2Rlist = fix seq2Rlist (s : seq R) : Rlist := match s with | [::] => nil | h :: t => cons h (seq2Rlist t) end : seq R -> Rlist Argument scope is [seq_scope]
last_nth : forall (T : Type) (x0 x : T) (s : seq T), last x s = nth x0 (x :: s) (size s)
nth_rcons : forall (T : Type) (x0 : T) (s : seq T) (x : T) (n : nat), nth x0 (rcons s x) n = (if ssrnat.leq (S n) (size s) then nth x0 s n else if eqtype.eq_op n (size s) then x else x0)
SF_cons_rcons : forall (h : R * T) (s : SF_seq) (l : R * T), SF_cons h (SF_rcons s l) = SF_rcons (SF_cons h s) l
sig_rec : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (P0 : {x : A | P x} -> Set), (forall (x : A) (p : P x), P0 (exist P x p)) -> forall s : {x : A | P x}, P0 s
head = fun (T : Type) (x0 : T) (s : seq T) => match s with | [::] => x0 | x :: _ => x end : forall T : Type, T -> seq T -> T Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope _ seq_scope]
behead = fun (T : Type) (s : seq T) => match s with | [::] => [::] | _ :: s' => s' end : forall T : Type, seq T -> seq T Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope seq_scope]
map = fun (T1 T2 : Type) (f : T1 -> T2) => fix map (s : seq T1) : seq T2 := match s with | [::] => [::] | x :: s' => f x :: map s' end : forall T1 T2 : Type, (T1 -> T2) -> seq T1 -> seq T2 Arguments T1, T2 are implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope type_scope function_scope seq_scope]
last = fun T : Type => fix last (x : T) (s : seq T) {struct s} : T := match s with | [::] => x | x' :: s' => last x' s' end : forall T : Type, T -> seq T -> T Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope _ seq_scope]
size = fun T : Type => fix size (s : seq T) : nat := match s with | [::] => 0%nat | _ :: s' => S (size s') end : forall T : Type, seq T -> nat Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope seq_scope]

```coq
intros H.
rewrite H.
reflexivity.
Qed.
```
